primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from human earthly credentials (refuse) to the spiritual knowledge and power of Christ's resurrection which secures the believer's future.

tekstueel_bewijs: God did not leave his soul in hell
God raised Christ from the dead
He comes back to get his people

object.identificatie: The Power of the Resurrection / Justification / Eternal Life

tekstueel_bewijs: there is a God above who judges and rules

helper.identificatie: The Risen Christ / The Holy Spirit (implied in worship)

tegenstander.identificatie: Death, Sin, Evil Oppressors, Earthly Pedigree
tekstueel_bewijs: Death is swallowed up in victory
every evil character... must go down
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but the 'last enemy' (Death) and systemic evil (Bigotry/Oppression).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's response to the gospel: counting earthly gains as loss to know Christ.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (Paul/Hearer)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The believer's 'counting as loss' is a response to the 'excellency' of what God has already done in Christ.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God did not leave his soul in hell
He comes back to get his people
voorbeelden_mens_subject: I count all things but loss

voorbeelden: It is a Christian's part to be hopeful
I only want to know that Christ is there
I know he knows the way

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Dunamis' (Power) of God which provides the competence the human subject lacks.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the 'flesh' (~S1) to the 'refuse' (S2) to the 'power' (S1) through Christ's action.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ's resurrection swallows up the contrary (Death).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; death and 'putrid excrement' are used to describe the alternative to Christ.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places the agency of salvation and the overcoming of death in the hands of Christ. Human effort is described as 'dung' compared to the 'power' of the resurrection.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Minor exhortation to 'struggle toward our feet'
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: something within makes us struggle toward our feet

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Believers do not keep Christ alive; Christ keeps believers alive.
Death is swallowed up in victory.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Paul is used as a witness of faith, not a moral hero to be emulated by effort.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Paul's life is a testimony to the sufficiency of Christ's power.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Assurance and hope in the face of death.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic comfort; salvation is entirely God's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from Paul's biography to the cosmic victory of Christ is seamless.
spanning_punten: The brief mention of 'struggling to our feet' slightly jars with the 'dung' metaphor of human effort.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: up from the grave he arose, with a mighty shout over his foes

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The power is Christological rather than explicitly Pneumatological.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: Strongly theocentric structure with Christ as the primary Subject of all salvific verbs.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The emphasis on 'Power' is appropriate for a resurrection sermon.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Death and Sin are already treated as cosmic enemies.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in grace-oriented preaching that keeps the focus on the 'Dunamis' of God.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'diminuendo' and 'takeoff' metaphors; actantial analysis reveals these are movements of the Subject toward the Object.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek 'skubala'; actantial analysis explains why 'skubala' functions as the Opponent to the Subject's mission.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'power' (Pouvoir) is not a human capacity but a modal endowment from the Risen Christ.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses a 'Subject-Switch' where the preacher's own inability to know politics or the 'how' of resurrection is replaced by God's absolute 'Pouvoir'.
